readOrder: 1. You are reading this file (SYSTEM-INDEX.json) — the manifest and context primer.
2. Read QUICK-REFERENCE.md for CSS variables, HTML patterns, and component snippets — this is your primary implementation file.
3. Read COMPONENTS.md only when you need detailed specs for a specific component (anatomy, variants, states, accessibility).
4. Reference copart-design-tokens.json only when you need exact hex values, font stacks, or dark mode equivalents.
5. Read ICONS.json when you need to implement icons — it contains SVG path data for all 120 design system icons.
6. Use ../components/tokens.css for CSS variables — import it, never duplicate token definitions.
7. Use ../components/header/ for the Copart header — always include it at the top of every page unless told otherwise.
rules: Always include the Copart header at the top of every prototype page unless told not to. Use components/header/index.html (logged-out) or components/header/loggedin.html (logged-in). Never recreate the header from scratch.
Shared CSS design tokens live in components/tokens.css. Import it rather than duplicating variables.
No pure red anywhere. Use the rose/magenta error palette (error-border: #D42A54).
No emoji in UI. Use Iconic icon set (inline SVG only, stroke="currentColor").
One Primary (blue) button per view. Secondary actions use Secondary or Tertiary variants.
Orange accent is for registration/onboarding CTAs and urgency badges only. Never for primary actions.
Dark mode: toggle via data-theme="dark" attribute on <html>. Semantic tokens swap automatically.
Monospace font (JetBrains Mono) for VIN numbers, lot numbers, bid amounts, timestamps.
Always pair color with icon + label for state indication.

UX Writing: sentence case everywhere, active voice, verb-first button labels, error format is '[what happened] — [how to fix]', use canonical terminology (Lot not listing, Bid not offer, Watchlist not favorites, Member not user). See QUICK-REFERENCE.md § UX Writing.
